title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a personalized greeting card! Use string concatenation (+) to combine:

1. A greeting: 'Hello' + [a name]
2. A message: 'You have completed' + [a number] + 'lessons!'
3. An encouragement: 'Keep going, you are doing' + [an adjective] + '!'

Make it your own!

hints.text: Remember to add spaces! "Hello"+"World" becomes "HelloWorld". Use "Hello "+" World" for proper spacing!
Forgetting spaces between words: "Hello"+"World" becomes "HelloWorld" instead of "Hello World"!
Mixing up (2+2) vs 2+2 in text: Without parentheses, C# glues text instead of doing math first!
Forgetting quotes around text: Console.WriteLine(Hello + World); won't work – they need quotes!

commonMistakes.correction: Review the correct syntax and best practices for this concept.
